title: Geospatial Analyst - NCOIC
description: Supervised a Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) Cell of seven soldiers including a Common Ground Station (CGS) team of three soldiers over a deployment to Kirkuk, Iraq. Managed over 60 personnel while conducting daily company operations and nighttime Unmanned Aerial System flight missions (UAS) of three or more; substantially decreased destructive activity in the region. Directed the Processing, Exploitation, Dissemination (PED) cycle at the unit level ensuring that all Priority Intelligence Requirements (PIRs) and Requests for Information (RFIs) were completed. Advised the Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization Manager for all JSTARS and UAS sorties relating to coverage areas, mission times and change of mission recommending space based or aerial sensors to satisfy to cover any intelligence gaps. Analyzed and synthesized data for Intelligence Products to identify avenues of approach, provide any battle damage assessments (BDA), identify Lines of Communication (LOC), geo-locate targets, fusing Moving Target Indicator (MTI), Full Motion Video (FMV) and Satellite Imagery. Maintained unit GEOINT equipment. Created a searchable database for Intelligence Products and shapefiles. Identified intelligence gaps and prepared reports of evaluations; recommended actions to senior analyst and supervisor. Managed, supervised, and performed intelligence activities and functions including exploitation, development, and dissemination of multi-sensor imagery products to support war fighting operations and counterintelligence activities. Counseled numerous soldiers through professional and personal turmoil resulting in a highly effective team environment. Prepared and maintained imagery intelligence products and responses to fulfill unit level intelligence requirements; briefed intelligence assessments and positions to staff principals and senior commanders within organization.

description: Created unit Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for Common Ground Station (CGS) and Ground Moving Target Indicator (GMTI) Forensic Analysis Cell (GFAC) and established protocol for all presentations and database management for the GEOINT Fusion Cell. Effective member of two GFAC teams of six or more soldiers over two 1 year long deployments to Baghdad, Iraq in Joint Service Assignments. Integrated intelligence with All Source, HUMINT and SIGINT in cohesive Fusion Products. Consistently recognized as the Subject Matter Expert. Chosen as corps Subject Matter Expert (SME) to provide intelligence in support of Special Operations Forces in Tal Afar, Iraq, utilizing GMTI Forensics Analysis programs, providing FUll Motion Video (FMV) support, SOCET GXP, ESRI ArcGIS, and GoogleEarth integrated Intelligence Products. Communicated with other GEOINT team leaders to produce Counter Terrorism (CT) products and advised subordinate units for collection. Operated the Common Ground Station to collect, organize, synthesize and analyze data then produced intelligence products to be briefed to the corps commander. Exploited and prepared intelligence briefs using national imagery assets; updated and provided current intelligence information for government and private sector records. Proven ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with multiple levels of management, government, and diverse cultural audiences in visibly high – tempo environments. Exploited economic, geographic, cultural, military, and political data to provide detailed analyses of enemy capabilities in support of war-fighting units involved in combat operations. Provided facility assessment (FA) and detection for current and future operational requirements; performed analysis of current mission performance and recommended improvements for future missions.

title: Director Pol-Mil Affairs (Africa)
company: Strategic Plans and Policy (J5), Joint Staff
description: Senior military officer responsible for development of strategy and policy recommendations for all military issues related to 53 countries in Africa. Led a high-quality team of professional mid-career Soldiers, Sailors, Airmen, and Marines to develop policy recommendations for the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and other senior uniformed and civilian leaders. Provided expert military advise and policy recommendations on a wide range of African security challenges to the National Security Council (NSC); and creatively fostered dialog with the NSC staff and interagency on appropriate DOD operations in support of national security objectives. Shaped policy recommendations, in coordination with State Department and other agencies, to ensure the NSC provided executable policy guidance for: DOD responses to potential crises springing from the effort to ensure independence of South Sudan; DoD support of efforts to restore security and establish a stable government and governing institutions in Somalia; and DOD actions in response to the turmoil of multiple overlapping African crises, from operations in Cote d'Ivoire to seat the elected president, Tunisia's ‘Arab Spring’ revolution, Operation Unified Protector in Libya and relations with post-Qaddafhi Libya; and continued support to combined efforts to defeat the Lord’s Resistance Army in Central Africa. Worked cooperatively with State Department to develop support and resourcing for programs focused on Security Sector Reform, peacebuilding, and leadership, with emphasis on DoD roles. Championed an initiative leading to a multilateral strategic approach to resolve the challenges in the Sahel resulting from the emergence of al-Qaeda in Mali.
name: Christopher Leins

title: Deputy Commander
description: Deployed to Djibouti as the deputy commander of a combined military organization of more than 3,000 U.S. and allied personnel with the mission to foster regional security cooperation with 13 nations of East Africa, strengthen their security capacity, and enable leadership development. As the senior U.S. Army officer, I used my knowledge of land force operations to improve the planning and execution of military-to-military training opportunities with our African partners, and to significantly improve the conduct of civil-military operations throughout the Horn of Africa. Developed and nurtured relationships with key senior military leaders in African partner nations, and worked with US interagency partners, including the Department of State and USAID, to facilitate a 'whole of government' approach to achieving US objectives in Africa.
name: Christopher Leins

groups.name: General and Flag Officer Network Group

description: I create psychedelic works, fashion designs, portraiture, and other amusements. I'm currently working on some dinosaur plushies.

title: Research Analyst
description: My current and offered research spans across several interdisciplinary fields, such as Communications, Political science, and International Relations, but is predominantly guided by Political Sociology, Network Analysis, Labour, and Policy. I'm currently engaged in research spanning two areas drawing from key works in Global Labour: on the Military/Civil Defense Industry as it relates to, and positioned within a globally integrated economy and West/Middle Eastern conflict. The second of which focuses on the core tenants that underly Political Sociology, paying unique attention to the utilization of Cyber networks and associations for political dissidence and religious/social/political extremism in the Global South.
name: Rachel Simon

title: Teaching Assistant - Department of Sociology
description: Assisted professors in various courses in both the Sociology and Criminology departments; Sociology of Law & Youth Justice; Introductory Sociology, Qualitative and Quantitative Research Methodology. Responsibilities included tutorial lecturing, providing one on one and first response to student inquiry and academic support in course development, as well as compiling, invigilating and grading written works, exams, research models/ other course related materials.
name: Rachel Simon

title: Support Specialist
description: Pursued an assignment to the Intelligence Analytics business unit as an Exec. Administrative Assistant providing first-line, point of contact support to 50 team members assigned to US Africa Command, US European Command, US Special Operations Command and deployed team members supporting mission sets in Afghanistan. My responsibilities included oversight to a large part of the logistical duties within the business unit, introducing streamlined methods of tracking personnel assigned to the most austere locations, developing analysis of team performance and becoming the business units key interface to all other internal business units, such as Human Resources, Finance and Training, and behaved as the outward face for the Intelligence Analytics team to external customers. http://www.shinesystech.com/ SHINE Intelligence Analytics offers proven experience and expertise in applying exploitation techniques using commercial and custom systems in support of military operations, counter intelligence, counter proliferation, counter terrorism, counter insurgency, counter IED, special operations, intelligence (e.g., HUMINT, SIGINT), targeting and criminal investigation. We are adept in efficiently and effectively offering actionable intelligence yielding immediate results in critical mission areas. Whether you are commander of a multi-national force or the CEO of a multi-national corporation, SHINE gives you the tools to enable decision authority.
name: Rachel Simon

title: Project Manager
description: Managed a small team of developers focused on the construction of software, information technology, and web-based projects. Utilized project management methods to ensure projects were completed on time and on budget while consulting directly with the CEO on the status of these projects. http://furi.ca/en/content/home/index/ Furi Enterprises Inc. is a technology consulting and software development company that provides expertise and leadership in web, internet, and mobile technologies, while maintaining a commitment to aesthetically pleasing and functional experiences. For the past eight years, Furi has been striving to match business needs with technology solutions, while aiming to utilize the latest and greatest technologies of our time. Furi's approach to solving problems aims for a level of openness, while maintaining technology independence to allow for some of the most innovative and creatives uses of technology without rebuilding the best of the breed technologies.
name: Rachel Simon

title: Senior Research Associate and Instructor, Middle East Studies
description: Primary duties in this position include, but are not limited to: - Conduct in-depth, graduate-level scholarly research of events, policies, and geographic regions related to designated areas of expertise -- currently the Middle East (especially Yemen, Syria, Iran and Egypt), Afghanistan and Pakistan -- within the Middle East Studies at MCU (MES). - Provide PME support to the MCU community and beyond as directed. - Write original monographs for publication both within the MES publications, including the MES Insights, Monograph and Occasional Paper series, and in outside forums. - Assist Director of MES in all budgetary requirements of MES. - Produce travel orders in the Defense Travel System in support of the Director of MES. - Produce and track all administrative actions associated with travel related to the MES, including those related to guest speakers for MCU sponsored symposia or lecture series associated with MES. - Ensure travelers are properly reimbursed for their expenses, coordinating all efforts with the VPAA resource advisor. - Maintain the MES webpage - Produce, editing and printing of MES publications, including MES Insights, the Monograph series, and the Occasional Paper series - Maintain and update a distribution list/system for MES scholarly works and other correspondences. - Serve as the MES “Events Planner,” initiating, overseeing, and executing all administrative actions associated with conducting MES-sponsored lecture series/symposia, including the Emerald Express series, the MES Lecture Series, MCWAR-MES Lecture Series and other events. Also to serve as the Contracting Officer Representative for the Emerald Express conference series, when the subject of the conference is within MES area of focus. - Provide completed travel documents and reconciliation information to the VPAA resource advisor.
name: Adam Seitz

groups.name: CESRAN | Centre for Strategic Research & Analysis

title: Research Associate, Burke Chair in Strategy
company: Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS)
description: Mr. Seitz was a research associate at the Center for Strategic and International Studies Arleigh A. Burke Chair in Strategy where his research focus was in Middle East and South Asia security studies, weapons of mass destruction, weapons proliferation, terrorism and asymmetric warfare. While working at the CSIS Burke Chair Mr. Seitz published a number of papers and reports on these subjects, including a book he co-authored with Dr. Anthony Cordesman entitled "Iranian Weapons of Mass Destruction: The Birth of a Regional Nuclear Arms Race?" (Praeger Security International, 2009).
name: Adam Seitz

title: Air Sensor Operator (first in the U.S. Army)
description: Task force ODIN: Conducted Reconnaissance, Surveillance and Target Acquisition missions in support of Conventional and Special Operations Forces, while having: Operated and instructed on the use of: an MX-15D Full Motion Video Camera, PeARL [Peters equipment Aerial Reconnaissance Low] Camera, Multiple AN PRC-117 communications (and associated Communications Security) devices, and various proprietary and OTS cartographical software. Supervised and participated in a variety of operations: High Value Target/Individual retrieval/destruction, Cordon-and-Search over-watch, area denial and interdiction, primary target selection/designation and Battle Damage Assessment, confirmed/denied suspected IED-associated activities/personnel, supported multiple ground and air units (manned, unmanned, fixed and rotary wing) simultaneously, target handover, designated for remote “Hellfire” missile engagement

title: Air Sensor Operator (first in the U.S. Army)
description: Task force ODIN: Conducted Reconnaissance, Surveillance and Target Acquisition missions in support of Conventional and Special Operations Forces, while having: Operated and instructed on the use of: an MX-15D Full Motion Video Camera, PeARL [Peters equipment Aerial Reconnaissance Low] Camera, Multiple AN PRC-117 communications (and associated Communications Security) devices, and various proprietary and OTS cartographical software. Supervised and participated in a variety of operations: High Value Target/Individual retrieval/destruction, Cordon-and-Search over-watch, area denial and interdiction, primary target selection/designation and Battle Damage Assessment, confirmed/denied suspected IED-associated activities/personnel, supported multiple ground and air units (manned, unmanned, fixed and rotary wing) simultaneously, target handover, designated for remote “Hellfire” missile engagement
name: David Firester
